EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Iron plate production setup at position around (16.0, 71.0)
Consists of the following entities:
- Burner mining drill at position (16.0, 71.0) facing down, placed on iron ore patch
- Stone furnace at position (16.0, 73.0) facing up, used to smelt iron ore into iron plates
- Wooden chest at position (17.5, 73.5) to collect iron plates from the furnace
- Burner inserter at position (18.5, 73.5) facing right, moving iron plates from furnace to chest and powered by coal

This structure forms a compact iron plate production line with mining, smelting, and collection integrated closely.

ERROR TIPS

### Errors placing inserters adjacent to occupied tiles
- When placing an inserter next to another entity (e.g., furnace), ensure the target tile is free. In Step 1, the inserter placement failed because a wooden chest occupied the intended tile.
- To avoid this, increase spacing, change placement direction, or select a different reference position for placing the inserter.

### Errors due to lack of fuel or ingredients in entities
- Furnaces and burner inserters require fuel (e.g., coal) to operate. Several logs indicate entities running out of fuel or waiting for source items.
- Always ensure to insert sufficient fuel into drills, furnaces, and inserters promptly to maintain continuous operation.

### Errors inserting items when inventory is empty
- Attempts to insert iron ore or coal into entities failed due to empty inventory.
- Before inserting items, verify that the inventory contains the required items.

### Errors placing entities too far from player position
- The burner inserter placement at position (16.5, 72.5) failed because the player was too far away (distance > 10).
- Move closer to the target position before placing entities to avoid placement distance errors.

### Correcting misplaced inserters
- Removing and replacing incorrectly placed inserters is necessary to maintain proper item flow.
- Double-check placement positions and directions before finalizing entity placement.

NAMESPACE
No user-defined functions have been declared in the provided steps.
